newsitem.title: USA: Apple's long-term woes still remain - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Apple's long-term woes still remain - WSJ.

text.p: Apple Computer's alliance with Microsoft does little to resolve the long-term problems that have reduced Apple to its present, woeful condition, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing industry officials.
The paper said in its electronic edition that the alliance does not address numerous fundamental questions, such as how does Apple reach out to new customers who do not already own an Apple.
"Without Microsoft, there's not much value there," one money manager -- David Dreman of Dreman Value Management -- told the paper.
James Underwood, a Dallas-based consultant who has just finished a study of Apple, put it this way: "The bottom line is that Apple's future market stinks," he told the paper.
